intro: Parathesis pajapanensis, commonly known as the Pajapanensis parathesis, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within dense forests. Its botanical features include a woody stem and palmate leaves with a glossy surface. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is the subject of conservation efforts.
